comments.body:
As this primarily provides a shared library 
```suggestion
  skip: true  # [win]
  run_exports:
    - {{ pin_subpackage(name, max_pin='x.x') }}
```

To check if the ABI tends to be stable between major, minor and patch versions [ABI Laboratory](https://abi-laboratory.pro/index.php?view=tracker) is one of the best places. You can also look/ask upstream to see if they have any policies around this. If you can't find anything a good approach is:
* If new version releases are very rare, pinning tightly is appropriate `max_pin='x.x.x.x.x.x.x.x'`
* If versions are more frequent, pinning on minor version releases is often okay

For more details see [here](https://docs.conda.io/projects/conda-build/en/latest/resources/define-metadata.html#export-runtime-requirements).
